Award.AwardTitle: Intelligent Biology and Medicine in 2018: Advancing Interdisciplinary Education, Collaboration, and Innovation

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Award.AbstractNarration:
The International Conference on Intelligent Biology and Medicine (ICIBM) aims to promote information science, technology, and education to a great variety of trainees and young investigators, including trainees, faculty, teachers, scientists, and engineers, and to provide a forum for the cross-fertilization of ideas. The 2018 meeting will held in Los Angeles June 10-12. Since its inception in 2012, ICIBM conference series has fostered the education of next generation of bioinformatics, systems biology, and intelligent computing scientists with cutting edge technologies and updated knowledge, as well as promoted informatics research in complex biological systems and agricultural, environmental, pharmaceutical, zoological, and data sciences. The travel awards for junior scholars are judged by the submission and quality of anticipated poster presentation. This award would provide support for 20 US-based students and junior scholars who would be engaged in posters. In addition, support is provided for four world leaders to speak at the meeting and interact with the junior scholars. The top scored manuscripts in peer-review will be selected for special issues in BMC journals and the International Journal of Computational Biology and Drug Design. ICIBM 2018 program will include four distinguished keynote speakers, conference invited talks, four tutorial and workshop sessions, scientific presentations, highlight talks, poster session, and other activities.

ICIBM 2018 will continue in providing innovative training and research collaborative programs catering to various levels of research expertise. Junior researchers will utilize resources to gain higher levels of training and information from senior experts, while established researchers will have continued access to collaborative communication and cross-disciplinary opportunities. Through extensive educational activities, collaborations, and interactions throughout the event, ICIBM 2018 will advance cutting-edge convergent research. The commitment to education and diversity through the inclusion of underrepresented students and other trainees, as well as the conference training opportunities, drives the establishment of a culturally and professionally diverse Trainee Committee. Special issues in BMC journals and the International Journal of Computational Biology and Drug Design help to insure broad dissemination of the insights and research. Support is provided for 20 students and four keynote speakers.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The International Conference on Intelligent Biology and Medicine 2018 (ICIBM 2018) took place in Los Angeles, California, USA on June 10-12, 2018. There were more than 180 attendees from diverse research areas, races/ethnicities, and general backgrounds, and from institutions across the USA and other international institutions. ICIBM 2018 featured eleven regular scientific sessions, four tutorials, one poster session, four keynote talks, and four eminent scholar talks. The scientific program covered a wide range of topics, including computational biology, 3D Genome Organization, reconstruction of large scale evolution of genomes and gene functions, artificial intelligence in biological and biomedical fields, and precision medicine. Both method/tool development and application in genomic research continued to be a main component in the conference, including studies on genetic variants, regulation of transcription, genetic-epigenetic interaction at both single cell and tissue level and artificial intelligence. In addition to the four keynote and four eminent scholar talks, ICIBM 2018 had a total of 66 oral presentations in eleven regular sessions in the areas of bioinformatics, computational biology, systems biology, machine learning, data sciences, and intelligent medicine. The 2018 scientific program was the largest among all the ICIBM conferences.

Four distinguished scientists were invited to be thekeynote speakers of ICIBM. All of them were able to attend and present at ICIBM 2018: 1) Dr. Joshua C. Denny, Professor and Director of the Center for Precision Medicine and Vice President of Personalized Medicine at Vanderbilt University Medical Center; 2) Dr. Paul D. Thomas, Associate Professor and Director of the Bioinformatics Division at the University of Southern California; 3) Dr. Alexander Hoffmann, Professor and Director of the Institute for Quantitative and Computational Biosciences (QCB) at University of California at Los Angeles; and 4) Dr. Jason Moore, Professor of Informatics and Director of the Penn Institute for Biomedical Informatics. These distinguished speakers talked about the frontier research in personalized medicine and big cohort data, reconstructing the large-scale evolution of genomes and gene functions, prediction of immune responses, and accessible artificial intelligence for data science. 

Twenty travel awards were provided to trainees from diverse backgrounds. Selection of these awardees wasbased on the quality of the research (paper or abstract), the financial need, and diversity/minority of the attendees. These travel awards encouraged the participation of young scientists in training from a diverse array of both scientific and societal backgrounds. All the travel awardees were able to attend the conference and presented their work. An award ceremony was given during the conference.

A total of 95 paper and 44 abstracts were submitted to ICIBM 2018. Each paper was reviewed by at least three Program Committee members. High-quality papers were accepted after satisfactory revision by peer-review again. These ICIBM 2018 special issues included:

  1. Supplement issue "Selected articles from the International Conference on Intelligent Biology and Medicine (ICIBM) 2018: genomics." BMC Genomics, Vol 20, Suppl 1.
  2. Supplement issue "Selected articles from the International Conference on Intelligent Biology and Medicine (ICIBM) 2018: Systems Biology." BMC Systems Biology, 2018. Vol 12, Suppl 8. 
  3. Supplement issue "The International Conference on Intelligent Biology and Medicine (ICIBM) 2018: bioinformatics." BMC Bioinformatics, Vol 19, Supplement 17. 
  4. Special issue “Genome Technologies in Human Genetics”, Human Heredity, Vol 83, No. 3, 2017/2018. 
  5. Supplement issue "Selected articles from the International Conference on Intelligent Biology and Medicine (ICIBM) 2018: Medical Genomics." BMC Medical Genomics, Vol 12, Suppl 1. 
  6. Supplement issue, “Selected articles from the International Conference on Intelligent Biology and Medicine (ICIBM) 2018: medical informatics and decision making”, BMC Medical Informatics and Decision Making. Vol 19, Suppl 1. 
  7. Special Issue "Integrative Approaches and Machine Learning in Systems Biology." International Journal of Computational Biology and Drug Design (IJCBDD). In press. 

This NSF fund substantially assisted in making this event quite valuable and successful. Overall, ICIBM 2018 proved to be highly enriching for all attendees, fostering valuable collaborative dialogue between investigators from diverse institutions, disciplines, and backgrounds. Young researchers and students gleaned excellent training and feedback through this event that will continue to encourage high-level knowledge and research in the fields of bioinformatics, systems biology, and intelligent computing. This opportunity for interactions and training at ICIBM 218 will, in turn, assist in continuing advancements and innovations in these important interdisciplinary fields, thereby furthering successful research in the future.
